attributes.action: National referendum on whether the voting age should be 16 or 18
attributes.additional_details:
This is a major change to our democratic system and a decision of this magnitude should not be decided by government but by the general public. 

This government was elected on a relatively small vote share and their views on the age of voting may not be reflective of the wider population. 

A referendum will deliver a clear result and build national consensus.
attributes.background: To hold a national referendum on the age of voting to decide whether it should be 18 or 16 years of age.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

We call for a referendum before extending voting rights to 16 & 17-year-olds: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/733679
